intro: Euphrasia subalpina, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent yellow markings. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in early summer. Euphrasia subalpina is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
